entry.title: Bear Stearns Building (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that at one point in 2008, the Bear Stearns Building (pictured) was worth approximately five times the price offered for the acquisition of Bear Stearns?

entry.title: a European settler in Kenya who tortured a black employee to death (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a European settler in Kenya who tortured a black employee to death in 1920 was sentenced to just two years' imprisonment?

entry.title: 1959 NCAA University Division Basketball Championship Game (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the California Golden Bears men's basketball team won the 1959 NCAA University Division Basketball Championship Game by a single point over West Virginia?

entry.title: Hamad al-Hajji (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Saudi Arabian poet Hamad al-Hajji lost three members of his family during his childhood and later suffered from schizophrenia until he died at the age of 49 after a lung disease?

entry.title: Jolly Rancher Remix (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that riders on the Jolly Rancher Remix can smell one of five randomly chosen Jolly Rancher flavors?

entry.title: Bhadun (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that television production companies working in Bhadun, Bangladesh, can hire a local woman as an extra for ৳500 (US$5.30) per day?

entry.title: Absolutely Sweet Marie (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Bob Dylan's "Absolutely Sweet Marie" was misspelled on several international releases of Bob Dylan's Greatest Hits 2?

entry.title: a civil servant (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a civil servant sued his own minister for libel?
